Mr. J wrote:

>
> Hi Guys,
>
> I am a little new to Heritrix, but gaining experience day by day.  I
> am wondering is there any setting that I can tell heritrix that for
> example
> http://www.siteA.org and http://www.siteA.extra.org is the same. 
>
Would adding a canonicalization rule that equates the two work for you? 
Both siteA.org and siteA.extra.org will have to be in scope.  Add a 
regex rule that equates siteA.extra.org to siteA.org. See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#urlcanon for more 
on Canonicalization.
St.Ack

> In this case siteA and .org is the key, so I want is if I mention
> siteA.org in the seed file and if the crawler encounter
> siteA.extra.org along the crawl, first priority is to treat
> siteA.extra.org as Site scope (so I won't be missing data), and second
> priority it is good if i can treat siteA.extra.org as same object as
> siteA.org so I won't have duplicate data in arc file.

>
> Any input would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Thx in advance
> Jay
>
